      • getClassName

        public static java.lang.String getClassName(java.lang.reflect.Type type)
        Object.toString() value is the fully qualified class name prefixed with TYPE_CLASS_NAME_PREFIX. This method will substring it, for it to be eligible for Class.forName(String).
        Parameters:
        type - the Type value whose class name is needed.
        Returns:
        String class name of the invoked type.
        See Also:
        Object.getClass()

      • getClass

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getClass(java.lang.reflect.Type type)
                                   throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Returns the Class object associated with the given Type depending on its fully qualified name.
        Parameters:
        type - the Type whose Class is needed.
        Returns:
        the Class object for the class with the specified name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class cannot be located.
        See Also:
        getClassName(Type)

      • newInstance

        public static java.lang.Object newInstance(java.lang.reflect.Type type)
                                    throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                           java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                           java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Creates a new instance of the class represented by this Type object.
        Parameters:
        type - the Type object whose its representing Class object will be instantiated.
        Returns:
        a newly allocated instance of the class represented by the invoked Type object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class represented by this Type object cannot be located.
        java.lang.InstantiationException - if this Type represents an abstract class, an interface, an array class, a primitive type, or void; or if the class has no nullary constructor; or if the instantiation fails for some other reason.
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the class or its nullary constructor is not accessible.
        See Also:
        Class.newInstance()

      • getParameterizedTypes

        public static java.lang.reflect.Type[] getParameterizedTypes(java.lang.Object object)
        Returns an array of Type objects representing the actual type arguments to this object. If the returned value is null, then this object represents a non-parameterized object.
        Parameters:
        object - the object whose type arguments are needed.
        Returns:
        an array of Type objects representing the actual type arguments to this object.
        See Also:
        Class.getGenericSuperclass()

      • hasDefaultConstructor

        public static boolean hasDefaultConstructor(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
                                     throws java.lang.SecurityException
        Checks whether a Constructor object with no parameter types is specified by the invoked Class object or not.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the Class object whose constructors are checked.
        Returns:
        true if a Constructor object with no parameter types is specified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - If a security manager, s is present and any of the following conditions is met:
        • invocation of s.checkMemberAccess(this, Member.PUBLIC) denies access to the constructor

        • the caller's class loader is not the same as or an ancestor of the class loader for the current class and invocation of s.checkPackageAccess() denies access to the package of this class
        See Also:
        Class.getConstructor(Class...)

      • getFieldClass

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getFieldClass(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                               java.lang.String name)
        Returns a Class object that identifies the declared class for the field represented by the given String name parameter inside the invoked Class<?> clazz parameter.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the Class object whose declared fields to be checked for a certain field.
        name - the field name as String to be compared with Field.getName()
        Returns:
        the Class object representing the type of given field name.
        See Also:
        Class.getDeclaredFields(), Field.getType()

      • getMethodReturnType

        public static java.lang.Class<?> getMethodReturnType(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                                     java.lang.String name)
        Returns a Class object that identifies the declared class as a return type for the method represented by the given String name parameter inside the invoked Class<?> clazz parameter.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the Class object whose declared methods to be checked for the wanted method name.
        name - the method name as String to be compared with Method.getName()
        Returns:
        the Class object representing the return type of the given method name.
        See Also:
        Class.getDeclaredMethods(), Method.getReturnType()

      • getEnumConstant

        public static java.lang.Object getEnumConstant(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                               java.lang.String name)
        Extracts the enum constant of the specified enum class with the specified name. The name must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in the given class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the Class object of the enum type from which to return a constant.
        name - the name of the constant to return.
        Returns:
        the enum constant of the specified enum type with the specified name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified enum type has no constant with the specified name, or the specified class object does not represent an enum type.
        See Also:
        Enum.valueOf(Class, String)
